message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to acquire a valuable product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1200000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll find it a great investment.
I appreciate your offer, but I'm looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $800000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value you're offering.

I understand you're looking to save some money, but I'm not willing to go that low. I can offer you a compromise at $1000000. This is a fair price considering the value of the product, and I'm willing to meet you halfway.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $900000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value you're offering.

I'm starting to think we're not on the same page, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $950000, but I'm not going any lower than that. This is my final compromise. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand your final compromise, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $920000 for the product. I think it's the best we can do, and I hope you'll consider it.

I've already made it clear that I'm not willing to go below $950000, and I'm starting to think you're not serious about buying the product. I'm willing to give you one last chance, but I'm not budging from $950000. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options, including selling to someone else.
